word: We have had an amount of the hardest kind of labor. Brother Van Horn did not bring the people up to do their duty, and as he was president of both conferences, the work devolving upon him left undone, left both conferences in a bad condition. For anyone to work after him (because he is one of the ablest preachers we have)--when a man with less preaching talent but with financial ability should come in there--bringing up the work to a healthful condition was not easy.
